intro: Scilla bellii, commonly known as the Sierra bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and rocky habitats. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. It is part of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like daffodils and lilies. Scilla bellii is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
